basics.name: Ryan Burnett
basics.label: UX Designer & Developer
basics.summary: Award-winning and certified UX designer and developer with demonstrated results in mobile and responsive design.

highlights: Redesigned the sign in and checkout UX at Fabric.com resulting in a $17 million annual revenue increase
Designed and developed the front end for new internal shipping application that added $2.5 million annual savings
Redesigned Home Decor site that increased conversion from 5% to 5.5%
Developed new AngularJS features for the Red Box application, a complete redesign of ADP’s client-facing site
Wired up data with $http get and post calls using a RESTful web API
Wrote Jasmine tests to automate code testing
Developed new features for the weather.com redesign
Integrated modules consisting of HTML, Sass, JavaScript and AngularJS into Drupal content management system
Managed each module as its own branch in git, submitting pull requests through Stash to merge into master
Created the responsive UI for Fusionetics, a medical web app used by the New York Yankees & Phoneix Suns
Developed interactive experience design documentation for consistent use of color, fonts, images and functionality
Built the front-end for insurance group Code SixFour using DotNetNuke
Implemented new features for existing sites such as stanford.edu, Stanford News & Stanford Events
Developed new top-level sites including Stanford Identity, Home of Champions, STAN 2011 & StanfordNYC
Redesigned content management systems such as the Stanford CMS & WordPress theme
Built mobile-friendly & responsive sites including Stanford Mobile, News, Parents, Dish & Commencement
Designed organic inpatient program Farm Fresh site that captured 4,500 visitors in its first month
Developed Bariatric Surgery site that beat benchmarks by 300%
Managed Microsoft SharePoint Intranet site, providing ongoing training, support & problem resolution
Utilized Google Analytics user data for an improved UI resulting in an 18% conversion increase
Created the Medical Center’s first blog and redesigned recruitment website & bi-weekly e-newsletter
Saved Stanford $30,000 & 141,000 sheets of paper annually through new hire communications redesign
Implemented enterprise-level Web sites with a creative team of designers, developers and programmers
Created sales prototype Web site for startup Bright Minds Software
Developed instructional design e-learning Web site for Faculte
Started communications firm handling all aspects including business development, sales and marketing
Established sales application that generated online business leads through Google, Yahoo and MSN
Designed and developed award-winning Web sites for Yahoo, ANB Insurance & The University of Alabama

education.institution: The University of North Carolina at Greensboro

awards.title: Gold International Hermes Creative Award
awards.summary: International awards competition for creative professionals involved in the concept, writing and design of traditional and emerging media
